parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Roads and Airports

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Order an AI airplane to land at a given airport.
'''Id''' is the number to identify which map airport you want the airplane to land at. See [[Arma: Airport IDs]] for more information.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.68 it is possible to also make the airplane land at a [[Dynamic_Airport_Configuration|dynamic airport]] [[object]] (e.g. aircraft carrier, makeshift runway...) – see '''Example 2'''.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> plane [[landAt]] id

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> plane: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> id: [[Number]] ([[Arma: Airport IDs|airport index]])

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> plane [[landAt]] airportObject <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.68</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> plane: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> airportObject: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_plane1 [[landAt]] 1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_dynamicAirport1 = "DynamicAirport_01_F" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
_plane1 [[landAt]] _dynamicAirport1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Arma: Airport IDs]], [[land]], [[setAirportSide]], [[assignToAirport]], [[allAirports]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 8, 2014 - 22:59 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In Arma 3 (1.34) landAt only works for fixed-wing aircraft. Rotary-wing craft ignore this command.
</dd>
</dl>
